Unfortunately, as for other pics I'd taken, I wasn't very happy with shots of my four-legged friends or the sunset shots I'd taken (we'd had rain and the sky was all kinds of amazing colors with the clouds).  In fact, my Samsung Galaxy III took better shots! Dread..this camera turned out to be a disappointed.  I really wanted to love this camera/brand but it looks like I'm going back to Canon...my trusted friend :)

Reviews.Title: I hate this camera
Reviews.Author: ice cream woman
Reviews.Content: I really do not like this camera at all. It's clumsy, even the sound it makes opening and closing the lens is oddly rough. It constantly tells me to wait until "recording is stopped" or announces the "card is not formatted". The AA batteries run out really fast.The photo quality is good. Everything else is annoying.

Reviews.Title: A great little camera.
Reviews.Author: Wayne Miskelly
Reviews.Content: I purchased the L610 just before going on a 14 night Caribbean cruise.  I took 280 beautiful pictures using mostly the auto setting.  I never needed flash, even in dimly lit rooms.  I put 2 lithium AA batteries in the camera.  They still show full power, even though I have looked at each of the 280 shots two times.  I love the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for everyday use.
Reviews.Author: GA
Reviews.Content: I wanted something in between my big Nikon and my CoolPix L10.  This is perfect.  My husband and 2 sons hike, canoe, kayak, and are always out somewhere.  We got the CoolPix L10 originally because it fits in a pocket but still gives great results.  I wanted something with a little more telephoto and better video for those trips and also indoor music performances by the boys.  All of us work in Boy Scouts, and I take pictures of the Cub Scouts to share with parents.  The CoolPix L610 is small and convenient,but I get great candid shots to use in slideshows and cards.  I have used this camera several times a week since I bought it.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: Great New Digital Nikon Camera
Reviews.Author: Sheila Saxton
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera.  It's very easy to use and takes great pictures.  I would recommend it to anyone looking for a new digital camera

Reviews.Title: Great! But, needs a round lense cover.  Has a very fragil mechanical door that covers the lense.
Reviews.Author: T. Lemons "Happydays"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great, but could use a hard round cover for the lens.  The mechanical door is fragile and could be easily punctured in a woman's purse.  Should probably be stored in a camera case.

Reviews.Title: Nikon L610
Reviews.Author: Most Helpful Review
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting a camera like this Nikon L610 for a while. It's a great, quality little camera I really enjoy. The pictures and video are 1080p HD, very sharp, and the camera has both HDMI and A/V output. It's very easy to use, it only took me five minutes to learn all the ins and outs. The flash pops up manually, which I like, because it prevents the flash from going off when you don't want it too. Nikon is a quality brand, and I can see the quality of this camera. The 14x optical zoom is great for a camera of this size. It moves fast and is very clear all the way zoomed out. I like that it runs on AA batteries, no charger to keep up with, and if you like taking pictures hiking outside you can always bring batteries with you, but  you can't bring outlets with you.Some have mentioned that it drains batteries, but if you get a good pack of lithium Rayovac AAs you should be fine. Just be sure to change the battery setting from alkaline to lithium. Overall, this is a great camera for the casual photographer or for vacations and events. I bought mine from Cameta Camera for $67 Nikon Factory Refurbished with free shipping. They sell here on Amazon and also on eBay. I saw this camera in Target originally, and it was $250. I saved a lot buying it refurbished. It came with the manual, software, batteries and a/v and usb cord. A pretty good deal if you ask me.

Reviews.Title: Great Used Camera
Reviews.Author: Victoria Troupe
Reviews.Content: My son broke my Coolpix L610, 2 months after i bought it from bestbuy brand new.I found this camera here onlineHonestly I will look here for a used camera before i go to bestbuy again.My used Camera is like Brand new. Excellent quality pictures, camera in great shape.All functions work.Honestly i did not just get a used camera, i got an outlet for my artistry

Reviews.Title: Poor battery life
Reviews.Author: SR
Reviews.Content: I went through a new set of 2 AA batteries everyday that I had this camera. The charge would plummet every time that I would take a video. I did not have this camera very long for this reason. Other than this the quality of the pictures seemed decent for a $130 camera.

Reviews.Title: Not good for families
Reviews.Author: Shawna Russ
Reviews.Content: This camera only uses regular batteries that drain very quickly and its slow. By the time it takes the picture our 17 month old has already moved. We bought this take capture her life but all we are getting is blur. Wish we would've spent more money the first time so we aren't stuck shopping for another camera already.

Reviews.Title: OK pics sometimes, built like cheap junk.
Reviews.Author: kenintexas
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife because she wanted something that takes good close-ups.  This camera does take good pictures SOMETIMES.  However, in some natural lighting situations , the camera seems to change the color of the subject, usually with a yellow hue;  I've had silver turn to gold, other colors just look dull.  I can take the same shot in the same lighting with my iPhone 4s and it looks perfectly natural.  And those close-ups?  Sometimes they are incredible, other times the camera struggles to focus, and produces a blurred shot.I wish Nikon would go back to Japan or somewhere to build their equipment, instead of using slave labor.  This is flimsy Chinese construction.  The door over the upload jack slot won't close.  The cheap, poorly designed battery door is a pain to keep shut.  All in all, I won't be throwing away another $200 on any Nikon products anytime soon, but I figure by now, you knew I'd say that.

Reviews.Title: Just DON'T do it....
Reviews.Author: Crimson Tate
Reviews.Content: ...and save yourself a lot of heartache.  The money you save by not purchasing a more expensive professional camera you will spend on purchasing tons of lithium batteries or rechargeable batteries and charger on this one.  The weight spared by Nikons L610 will be gained by the bagful of extra batteries you will have to lug around with you.  I purchased this camera,(unfortunately for the Nikon name) from Target, 9 months in advance of my daughters championship solo dance so that I could learn how to use it and which settings to use for the appropriate situations. I didn't want to overuse it as it was dedicated especially for this one time performance, but I learned everything about it and knew how to use it..On the actual day I prepared the correct settings and put brand new lithium batteries in the compartment. When her music started I turned on the camera (not sooner to prevent draining the batteries), and to my horror it kept shutting off. The dance started as I was madly slamming in new batteries. After less than 30 seconds of filming (with the 2nd set of batteries) I got the "battery exhausted" message. The performance was over, never to be done again. Not only do I not have a keepsake video, I didn't even get to watch her perform due to messing with this darn camera. To add insult to injury I tried to take some photos of her and her team mates after the show. Every photo but one, was blurry. The girls hated standing and waiting for the flash and for the camera to re-set.  To date I have not been able to take one decent pic of a person or group of people or pets with this camera.  I know everything about this camera and yet my 10 yr olds recycled phone took better pics. This camera is a piece of garbage and that is exactly where it went.

Reviews.Title: Seems like a good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Seems like a good camera for the price. So far the pictures look good. Fits well in hand and pretty easy to use.

Reviews.Title: okay camera
Reviews.Author: Maria M
Reviews.Content: The batteries are hard to get in and out as the latch sticks.You have to press hard to get a picture to take and when you press hard you usually move the camera a bit which results in a blurred photo--have to take many pics to get one good one.

Reviews.Title: OK Camera
Reviews.Author: Derrick Johnson99
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera on our vacation. Small enough to fit in a pocket.Bought it because we wanted a camera that we could put in double A batteries. Great pictures, but slow shutter speed. Slow picture taking. Had to anticipate action shots. Quick multiple shots are out of the question.

Reviews.Title: CHEEZE
Reviews.Author: Mike A.
Reviews.Content: Great little camera, takes outstanding pics and the price was right. Add a Square Trade Extended Warranty and start taking photos.

Reviews.Title: I like it for the price.
Reviews.Author: B. jones "coast guard aux/parent"
Reviews.Content: It seems to be pretty much as expected - specially for the price I am happy. I will miss a feature that I had on my previous Lumix camera - that of being able to crop & enlarge pics right on the camera.

Reviews.Title: Happy Customer - Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Matt Bailey
Reviews.Content: Please see the other reviews about how to make changes in the camera settings.  Makes a huge difference.  Pictures come out sharp and look great!  Even in low light the pictures look great.  Usually the zoom features on cameras make the pictures pixelated.  Not with this camera.  At full zoom the pictures look great.  When outdoors I change the scene setting to "Landscape".  The pictures turn out sharp and crisp.  Nothing but great pictures as long as you do your part and hold the camera steady!  AA batteries are very convenient.  Use the Energizer Lithium and change the setting in the camera from standard batteries to lithium and they last forever!  Macro feature works great as well.  Remember to read other views about making changes in the camera settings! We are very happy with our purchase!

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera EVER made!!
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: It had lens problem.I didn't use it much either.After a while it stopped working because of lens for no reason.Then I send it for repair.They repaired it, and after awhile it started to have the same problem again!!total waste of MONEY!!!

Reviews.Title: Battery killer
Reviews.Author: Christian Whitney
Reviews.Content: The picture and video quality were fine, but it uses AA batteries and burns through them quick when shooting video.

Reviews.Title: Quality Product
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Easy to use. Worked great on moving boat as well as inside museum. Highly recommended and so easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Camera for my wife.
Reviews.Author: Pete F, "Pete F."
Reviews.Content: What better Christmas present for my wife?  She has challenged me to a competitive photo shoot of some arbitrary subject or area.  After she gets this camera, we'll see.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was only a few months away from having my second child and needed a new camera that I could trust. I have had a Nikon in the past and loved it! So the only choice was to look at the same brand. Love my new camera!

Reviews.Title: Xmas gift
Reviews.Author: Deb
Reviews.Content: We purchased this for 13 year old granddaughter. She loved the cool color and enjoyed taking lots of family/ friend photos.

Reviews.Title: Too soon to rate.
Reviews.Author: MICHAEL
Reviews.Content: The fact is, I have not used this camera, yet.  It was rated very highly in reviews.  I expect it will be rated "I love it" soon enough.

Reviews.Title: It's okay.
Reviews.Author: slbcnv "slbcnv"
Reviews.Content: This camera is fairly straightforward and easy to use, and the pictures seem to be of good quality. I would not recommend this camera for a parent with active kids or someone who takes shots of moving subjects. It is really hit or miss as to how blurry the end result will be. It did do well for us on our vacation, however, and we have a tendency to be very hard on cameras, so it must be a hearty little camera. I would not have bought it, however, if I had tried it out first.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but the "Batteries Exhausted" message seems to be a problem
Reviews.Author: awebbiz
Reviews.Content: I returned the Nikon Coolpix L620 I ordered because it kept giving an "exhausted batteries" message even when the lithium batteries were good. It goes through batteries very quickly. I'd suggest rechargeable batteries and charger purchase to go with it. Other than that it took great photographs.

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this camera. It was a new camera but an older model. The camera was returned because it was defective and I lost patience with Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Good but tricky
Reviews.Author: Jack Winkler
Reviews.Content: I like the power source:  AA batteries.  It was recommended for everyday use by Conslumer Guidel I found the procedure to transfer pictures from the camera to my computer a little tricky

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for..
Reviews.Author: granny too
Reviews.Content: I seen this camera recommended on Tv  and finally decided to get it .I take a lot of pictures of nature and grandchildren and felt this camera would be great for me.I've always bought Kodak cameras and wasn't pleased with the quality. What pictures I've taken so far with this camera has been excellent and I'm planning on enjoying using this camera over the Christmas holiday.I was surprised as to how fast I got my camera it came 3 days after ordering it now that's fast

Reviews.Title: short battery life
Reviews.Author: Minou C.
Reviews.Content: The camera was a little heavier than I expected.  There is a delay in almost all functions.  The battery life lasted 2 days while we were on vacation in Europe.  We had to replace the batteries every two days.  I would not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Ra
Reviews.Content: Works well. Replaces one I broke.  Great camera. The factory repair wanted more to repair my camera than I paid for this.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: Cliff
Reviews.Content: I love the optical zoom in this camera.  Large screen really helps.  I love that it uses regular AA batteries-no specilal charger.

Reviews.Title: coolpix L6 camera
Reviews.Author: Doreen Fletcher
Reviews.Content: Received camera timely and it was very easy to set up and use.  The instructions and menu's are clear and easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: Fragile camera
Reviews.Author: WW "WW"
Reviews.Content: The camera takes good pictures, battery life is short ,it is very fragile. Stopped working in less than 3 months while on a trip.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous camera!!
Reviews.Author: Jolene
Reviews.Content: The clarity and color are amazing for a camera at this price point. The video is amazing as well. Wecouldn't be happier with this camera! We do recommend the lithium batteries that have to be purchasedseparately,

Reviews.Title: Eats Batteries
Reviews.Author: Raymond D. Weaver
Reviews.Content: Great camera but it goes through batteries like crazy. It's hard to believe that a manufacturer would put a product on the market with this big of a flaw/ Consumer Reports had it as a "best buy" and I can't believe that they tested this camera for any length of time or they too would have found this flaw. I have had to replace batteries after each use. Before I purchased I did see some consumer reviews that mentioned this problem. I could never imagined that it would be this bad. Maybe not all cameras of this model have the problem but don't buy this camera unless you are prepared to lug around a 20 pack of AA batteries.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Harrison
Reviews.Content: This camera was a birthday gift for my grown daughter.  She loves it and has made numerous, beautiful photographs with it.  I am tempted to buy one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Del L. Hammond
Reviews.Content: Controls and menus are easy to use. Good features and nice display screen. My DSLR probably won't get much use now since this is so handy and takes great photos with little effort.

Reviews.Title: NIKON COOLPIX L610
Reviews.Author: David F. Daniels "viewer Lola"
Reviews.Content: Just received this camera ON TIME and AS DESCRIBED. The first photos appear to be much better than our old point & shoot cameras. Downloading included software was easy, the manual and attachments were included, an on-line manual was also available. The price was great as were online reviews we checked! Thanks! dave4lolad 9 September 2013

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Linda K
Reviews.Content: Great camera for a novice. It finds faces in the viewing area and zooms in and out quickly. Display is very clear. Buy a large memory card as you will want to take lots of photos.

Reviews.Title: Pros and Cons
Reviews.Author: duluthmama
Reviews.Content: I have had several Coolpix cameras. This model is a good camera for casual user, to take a few photos of the grandkids, and small enough for a pocket. However, If you take lots of photos, upgrade to another model. The zoom tends to give fuzzy photos and the camera's response time is slow (for zooming, between taking photos, etc.). This camera eats batteries so be sure you have a handful of spares.

Reviews.Title: My new best friend ;-)
Reviews.Author: Pohonui
Reviews.Content: I take this camera everywhere. I love it. I have had some issues with batteries running out real fast, but am hoping if I put better batteries in it that will change. I love the close up feature. I bought this to replace a Canon that I also loved, but this has a much better close up feature. Loved them both, but dropped the other...glad to have this as a replacement.

Reviews.Title: Disapointed...
Reviews.Author: Fotini
Reviews.Content: If you want to take still photos only, it's a great camera. But not good at all for everyday life shootings (kids, animals, sports etc.) as they all come blury. Not to mention battery life!!! I have to move around with packs of batteries. Never expected such results when checking its specs. I give two stars for easy handling, nice look, great zoom and really great low light (still) pics. I had cheaper cameras that gave better results.

Reviews.Title: Lousy Battery Life, slow response
Reviews.Author: Bill Burrows
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a trip to Kenya where I took approximately 500 pictures at a meeting and on a six-day game-watching safari.  Everyready and Duracell battery companies should have a very profitable year, because I was going through a set of batteries for about every 30 to 40 photos in full daylight without a flash.  When I took a series of flash pictures indoors, the number of photos went down even moreIn addition, it was slow and unresponsive when I tried to change the zoom level.On the positive side, when you got it focused, including at 14x, the pictures were quite good.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: JFB
Reviews.Content: Fits easily into jacket pocket and takes great pictures. "photo-shop" software that came with the camera is excellent for detailed clean up and enhancement of photos.

Reviews.Title: It's okay, but...
Reviews.Author: Kenneth E. Krawczyk "kenkraw"
Reviews.Content: A nice enough camera, in that you don't have to mess with settings.  On the bad side, it's plastic, and apparently the old time cheap plastic, as after owning it for about four months, the battery compartment cover would not stay closed.  Then, a very small piece of plastic broke off and I can't keep the door closed without a rubber band.My conclusion:  don't buy a camera made out of plastic if there is something else available.

Reviews.Title: EXCELENT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Adolfo Uribe Gelvez "auribe"
Reviews.Content: GOOD OPTION FOR FAMILY, LIGHT, WITH THE ADDITIONALS INCLUDED, RECOMMENDED BY THE MARK AND WARRANTY FOR BUSINESS AND PLEASURE OK

Reviews.Title: so so...not quite a point and snap
Reviews.Author: A. Smith
Reviews.Content: I miss my old point and snap, as by the time i get this thing focused, the event is usually over. If i have a full minute or more to get camera ready, it does okay. But at sporting events, parties, baby smiles, and graduation, very hard to use, as the 'moment' passes by too quick for the camera to react. However, when taking still shots of adults or older children who sit still, nice pictures are produced. Therefore, i am not quite sold yet on this camera, because of the difficulty point and shooting quicky. I have been using it for 9 months and wish i had a different one now.

Reviews.Title: Battery killer, sluggish response, decent pics
Reviews.Author: B. Witt "wittba"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at Target, but price matched with Amazon. I took it on a trip to France, where it performed well enough. I was a good size and had all the basics for a point and shoot, including decent zoom.  However, I wish I had paid closer attention to the reviews on Amazon because it destroys basic alkaline batteries within minutes.  And I do mean Minutes.  High quality rechargbles are a must.  While it has the basics, the response is a bit slow.  All this being said, the pics came out pretty well. The operator (me) was my biggest enemy.Also note that it takes high def videos.  I disovered that my older laptop was unable to handle the graphics required to play these back.  They can be converted, but i might have lowered the setting had I known.

Reviews.Title: Very Slow.  Eats Batteries.
Reviews.Author: Boyd A. Miller
Reviews.Content: I don't like this camera because it is very slow.  It is especially slow after taking a picture before it is ready to take the next one.  We like to travel and take pictures.  Almost every time we find ourselves saying "hold it...the camera isn't ready"  when we are snapping pictures.  It also consumes batteries like crazy, especially when it is cold outside.  I recommend having 6 extra batteries handy if you plan to take a lot of pictures in a given day.I definitely would not recommend or buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Batteries get "exhausted" rather quickly!
Reviews.Author: cinderolla "cindy"
Reviews.Content: The pictures are fine and operating the camera straight forward, but the batteries wear out with the expression "batteries are exhausted."  Does this mean if they rest, they will work again?!?  Had I realized the battery was not rechargeable, I may have selected another model.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L610
Reviews.Author: Dennis R. Vazquez
Reviews.Content: This camera is rated five stars because the pictures are very good quality, The camera is not overly complicated like many digital cameras, it can use standard size batteries rather than specialized batteries, the screen is very bright and large. This camera was bought factory refurbished and  at a great price. It is a perfect size to carry in a pocket or purse. What more could you want in a Digital Camera????

Reviews.Title: nikon camera
Reviews.Author: makeba
Reviews.Content: great camera, easy to use, love the color, i like the side grip and the fact that its waterproof ( i hope)

Reviews.Title: Very nice!
Reviews.Author: John A. Bethke "JAB"
Reviews.Content: Can't Write a techinal review, but enjoy using it for general photography, and am happy with the product.  The more detailed reviews I've seen and caused me to purchase this are correct.

Reviews.Title: Slow in taking pictures, video is slow
Reviews.Author: Shibley
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera that would take quick photos and this one does not. The video taking when down loaded is slow. This does not have a rechargeable battery either, something I would have liked, but did not check before buying. Not really impressed with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L610 16 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Paul H Dixon Jr
Reviews.Content: Had this same camera before and it was damaged when I took it out in rain, not waterproof.Really liked the camera and bought another one the same.It is a little slow to focus at times, and at times photos can be blurry.Takes good photos when it is held steady and focused correctly.Does not take multiple photos as fast as I would like but for the price it is good.Not too good for dark or low light situations.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera
Reviews.Author: michelle marchini
Reviews.Content: This camera is the most amazing one I have ever owned. I have always been into amateur photography and this has it all for a great low price than a lot of other cameras like the rebel.Its also really compact and it fits in most cases that Ive bought for it and had previously.The only cons I have about this camera are: 1. it is very hard to find a neck strap that fits this camera 2. It goes through a LOT of batteries.I recommend buying a battery charger and rechargeable batteries:)

Reviews.Title: Nikon
Reviews.Author: el wadler
Reviews.Content: have only used it a few times; once I learn all the ins & outs I'm sure I'll love it.

Reviews.Title: Excelent camera
Reviews.Author: ricardo
Reviews.Content: Just love the L610 camera, takes excellent still shots as well as movies with this amazing little camera. Go NIKON

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great value!
Reviews.Author: Priscilla Martinez
Reviews.Content: I went with the Consumer Reports review of the Nikon Coolpix. And am very happy with my purchase! Easy to use, pics look great! Inexpensive camera with excellent results!

Reviews.Title: ok camera
Reviews.Author: anthony sirigos
Reviews.Content: the camera takes nice pictures but the battery compartment kept opening and also the flash takes a while to recharge

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Carolyn M. Henry
Reviews.Content: Right out of the box, a few quick reads...and off I go.  This little camera is all that it promises to be.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: M. Espinar
Reviews.Content: The price was ok and this nikon camera has the portability + some really cool setting to take nice pictures.

Reviews.Title: Nikon
Reviews.Author: Imre Kadar
Reviews.Content: Arrived really fast in a decent pack. I must confess and admit that the batteries run out quite soon. By the way makes outstanding pictures and video.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: Steve Benson
Reviews.Content: The only problem is that sometimes the SD card needs to be reseated to avoid the message "This card cannot be used."  But, the same thing happens when I plug the card into my laptop, so it's not the camera's fault.  Otherwise, it works great, and the macro function is excellent.  It's a little hard on standard alkaine AA batteries, so I'll be getting some of the Lithium Ion AA rechargables.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera For The Price
Reviews.Author: Doug Shealy
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and takes quality pictures.  Like other reviews stated, it does go through batteries.  This is not a big deal as it takes AA size batteries and so I purchased some rechargables and a charger in a big box store for less than $20.

Reviews.Title: Good some of the time
Reviews.Author: Nathan
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful camera that takes amazing pictures sometimes.I have had a chance now to take about 300 pictures and 2 hr video now. The video is limited to 29 min segments.  I have found that this is NOT a very good point and shoot at the spur of the moment camera. It takes thinking about the shot a moment setting the camera and a steady hand. Despite the almost perfect grip it is prone to blurry shots if i'm inpatient.  To take motion shots set up 8 mp and 3200 ISO with the flash when indoors.  The wide angle is great for indoors I can get three people on a couch from barely 2 ft away but it does cause some distortion on close videos.  The only really bad thing I have to say about it is that the zoom is incredibly slow and does this weird thing, that if I try to change it too quickly after a shot nothing happens and I have to try again.  For the price it does what I expect it too I was just expecting a little more intuition built in hence the 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: Not perfect, but good so far.
Reviews.Author: dd491231
Reviews.Content: Good stuff... Functions as it should so far.  Price reasonable.Negatives... Doesn't come with case; No plug-in recharge (uses regular AA batteries); No screen protectors; and no memory card.  You have to buy all this extra.A good camera.

Reviews.Title: Beware of Design Flaw
Reviews.Author: D. Hanhurst "Donh"
Reviews.Content: I've been using this for about 6 months and the still picture quality is great, the video is marginal and unreliable due to battery and SD card capabilities. I use SanDisk Ultra 32 GB and Coolpix rechargeable batteries and still the video time is unreliable and in short "bursts". I have always been wary of the battery cover door because of the apparent pressure on a very flimsy locking mechanism. I dropped the camera from about 2 ft on a carpeted floor and the battery compartment flew open and the locking mechanism was broken. This is the "Achilles Heel" of  this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great photos and easy to use
Reviews.Author: solar-glass "fj201"
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a second camera for my wife when she doesn't carry the digital SLR and it has become her every time camera

Reviews.Title: it takes great photos
Reviews.Author: Keith Reifsteck
Reviews.Content: I took this to a family reunion.  my daughter her friend where playing on play ground equiptment, the still photos it took of them on the marry go round and swing where very professnial quailty

Reviews.Title: Battery hog
Reviews.Author: tonipng
Reviews.Content: I love this camera's idea - nice large screen, lots of features, but it uses batteries like crazy.  Seems like I have to replace them way too often.  I'm very disappointed that I have to carry a ton of batteries with me on a trip that we're going on.

Reviews.Title: Design error
Reviews.Author: HW
Reviews.Content: The L-610 has a design error in that the battery sensor declares a dead battery when the battery is only 2/3 depleted.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: ken
Reviews.Content: Wife used it on a trip to Israel and shot 1200 photo's and videos.Focus was sharp and good feature is being able over ride the flash as a hardware control.

Reviews.Title: It is the easiest to use camera we have purchased so far.
Reviews.Author: Roy Wyatt
Reviews.Content: Excellent price and easy to operate, I looked at reviews and was concerned at 1st with battery life but the lithium enigizer have lstest through 50+ photos and still holding charge.

Reviews.Title: Remarkable quality in a small camera
Reviews.Author: Savvy Lady
Reviews.Content: I generally use it as a point and shoot.  Great quality photos.  But the camera gives the option of more specific adjustments, such as night time, action, closeup, panorama, etc.  Have only had for a month so am still getting a feel for its performance.

Reviews.Title: Eats scads of batteries
Reviews.Author: Scott Pauli
Reviews.Content: On my second L610 and today it used 6 batteries for pics - not movies, over a 6 hour time period.  The last one used 10 one day!  Is anyone else having this problem?

Reviews.Title: Great specs, not good for shooting active subjects
Reviews.Author: Steve H.
Reviews.Content: This camera takes some really good quality pictures and the zoom is good, but a little touchy.  My only complaint is that when trying to get shots of grand kids the auto-focus is slow and often I get empty pictures where a kid stood a moment before. You also cannot show several shots continuously, the cycle time between shots can be several seconds. battery life can get really short, especially when shooting video.Overall a great camera for vacation pics but not the best for people.

Reviews.Title: Battery Eater
Reviews.Author: Daniel L. Garcia "Electric#5"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera locally and I should have read the reviews that Amazon had . In trying to get everything setup with the batteries that were supplied, I drained them to nearly exhausted or 7/8 charge gone. I do not like the way that one has to get in and setup the date and time. It is a bit bulky and it seems to blur some of the pics. After having it for 2weeks I find that I am not overly fond of this camera. In these 2 weeks it has used up at least 6 to 8 batteries and I have my doubts that I will keep it. I will attempt to find a camera that would be more to my liking.

Reviews.Title: Great design
Reviews.Author: Jean "serious tea drinker"
Reviews.Content: A good replacement from that luminix I had.  Sometimes a camera can be too small. That grip on the rightHelps steady you shots.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: Oscar Cardenas
Reviews.Content: Me parece muy facil de manejar. Tiene muy buen peso y las  fotos y videos son de muy buena calidad. Una muy buena compra

Reviews.Title: Drains battery!!
Reviews.Author: Jannita L Hoff "Jhoff"
Reviews.Content: 'AA'  battery power exhausted in less then 24 hours EVEN when no pictures taken! I am looking into rechargable battery pack.

Reviews.Title: A Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Marshall Pipkin "--"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my bride, and she loves it, especially the 3D feature.  True, you'll need a pocket full of extra batteries when you go for a shoot, but just take them.  The camera works very well.

Reviews.Title: Man this sucks!
Reviews.Author: tracy feri
Reviews.Content: I thought I was shopping carefully and could hardly go wrong with a Nikon, but I seem to have been mistaken.  Almost every picture I have taken with it turns out to be blurry! The only thing I do really like about it is the macro lens that lets me take extreme close-ups.  I know 2 people who own the Nikon model that is one or two years older than this, and theirs take great pics! I am very disappointed.  In fact, I'm planning on returning it if I still can.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: ioBuddha
Reviews.Content: I have a D800 which I do not want to lug around when we are just going out for a simple day of fun. The settings are very Nikon and once you fine tune all of the settings the camera will take nice quality images. Much better than my iPhone 5 that is horrible indoors. My only complaint is that the processing from photo to photo is a tad slow, but I'm used to my DSLR so I did not ding it for that. I like Nikon quality and this is perfect for the family to mess with and for the price I am not very worried if it gets banged up a bit. My favorite feature is that it takes normal AA batteries... that is a great feature.

Reviews.Title: Quality not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Nancy
Reviews.Content: With this item being a NIKON product I really expected better quality. The shutter doesn't open and close all the time and the battery door is hard to close and is not sturdy at all.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Geri Reid
Reviews.Content: Camera was just as described. Came with everything needed to start taking pictures. I like that it takes regular batteries, you can always keep a supply of fresh batteries on hand.

Reviews.Title: Got Batteries?
Reviews.Author: Steve H
Reviews.Content: Before I bought this camera I read some reviews that it requires batteries but that was the understatement of the year, this is ridiculous. Sure, get rechargeables or use lithium... Hey I know, NIKON PEOPLE: All you make are CAMERAS - can't you figure this out?  I will probably just get a Sony camera that works as well, similar price, doesn't require new or recharged batteries every 2 weeks (minimal usage).Besides the over consumption of power,...the camera is OK.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Betty's special orders
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures,it is better than any small camera I've ever had,I plan on taking it on all my trs to get great memories of my trips.

Reviews.Title: Too many problems
Reviews.Author: knowledgeable
Reviews.Content: Terrible in low light! No forcing the flash on, it's always on auto when you have it popped up. Batteries lasted about 20 pictures when using flash before they died. It was always a gamble if the photo would come out blury. I recommend looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Good digital camera with very good zoom and quality
Reviews.Author: Michael Sarajev
Reviews.Content: Good digital camera with very good zoom and quality, easy and nicely to use, take a photo, walk wherever you want

Reviews.Title: Great starter!
Reviews.Author: LMS
Reviews.Content: Great camera, easy to interpret instructions.  Bought this for my mother in law and she is enjoying it very much!!

Reviews.Title: Nikon CoolpixL610
Reviews.Author: Mark D. Mccrady "running man"
Reviews.Content: Has very many features that makes it easy to take great pictures, or just put it on auto, and it will select the settings according to conditions.

Reviews.Title: great deal
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Actually, i cannot give a complete review as to the quality of images produced from this camera. It was bought as a Christmas gift, so i have not actually taken any pictures with it.  However, the layout is excellent, as is the size and the form and the security of the grip area. That's one of the reasons we bought it; my mom has severe arthritis and many cameras are hard to hold. The quickness of the functions and image capture are great, and the size is perfect. 2nd biggest reason for the purchase was the zoom. 3 times the zoom she used ot have. For us, this was the best option. The price from amazon was the icing on the cake. Local camera stores selling for $179 and we almost bought from walmart for $149, but came across a tremendous deal thru amazon. Thank you very much. Dan

Reviews.Title: Handy, Great Pics
Reviews.Author: Rajan
Reviews.Content: The Nikon coolpix is good except for the battery...The 1st set lasted only 25 snaps...The battery drains very quickly.  Other than this it is a great camera..Like it very much and very handy for beginners.

Reviews.Title: takes great pictures
Reviews.Author: Seana
Reviews.Content: easy to use and very functional.  Great quality for the price.  The pictures look great.  Much faster than our old camera- we can actually catch what's going on!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: shoe-grl2000
Reviews.Content: Camera is great for a beginner, however when trying to get a shot in motion, it's terrible it's all blurry. Will eat through normal batteries like nothing I've ever seen, highly recommend rechargeable batteries for this camera. All in all it's a basic entry level camera

Reviews.Title: My husband loves this camera
Reviews.Author: Patricia Sullivan "student of the stars"
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift for my husband.  He loved it and has had nothing but good things to say about it since Christmas morning.  The pictures really are beautiful.  Plus it is a cool looking camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Received for Christmas and finally had a chance to really use it today. Video'd my son's bball game and took 15 pictures. Fantastic! The video is crisp and clear even when zoomed close. The quality exceeds my expectations for a $149 camera. The camera is a little bulky but it's solid. The batteries drain fast but I got 25 min. of video and the batteries still had 1 bar when I shut down, using energizer NiMH rechargeables. Pictures are nice and crisp. Really enjoying the camera!

Reviews.Title: Keep lithium batteries on hand!
Reviews.Author: G. R. McDowell
Reviews.Content: Nice camera, gave it as a present; Christmas  you know,I hope you got one for Christmas 2012 too !

Reviews.Title: Not what I thought
Reviews.Author: K. Jones "Kel Jo"
Reviews.Content: Not what I thought it was nice and light weight but the battery life is very short.  Didn't get mant shoots taken and the batteries were showing little charge left.  It takes 2 AA batteries.  Disappointing for a NIKON.

Reviews.Title: OK Camera
Reviews.Author: RayH
Reviews.Content: Originally I really liked this camera.  Then we began to notice a too many of our pictures were blurry and unusable.  I've determined it seems to happen mostly in low light (or indoors) when the subject moves.  Pictures taken outdoors in bright light seem to be fine.  I presume the problem is related to the shutter speed but have not yet pursued the problem with the manufacturer.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L610
Reviews.Author: Brenda L Brooks
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera! I love being able to take clear close and distant pictures. Easy to use, small and fits in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: Just what she needed!
Reviews.Author: Kathleen
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my tech-savy daughter for Christmas.  She's very impressed with all the creative options and plans to have an exciting time capturing her trip to Italy in the spring!

Reviews.Title: Nikon finally got it right with mid grade camera
Reviews.Author: Mesmerize
Reviews.Content: I have owned a coolpix L 100 which is a good camera but could not change ISO settings so you had put in shooting mode with low ISO to get really good pictures from it. But they got it right with the coolpix l610 ISO settings are auto or you can manually change ISO for whatever your needs are. This camera takes 2AA batteries alkaline, lithium, or rechargeable. Only downside is battery not as good as my coolpix l 100 but that did take 4 AA maybe why it had better battery life but still a great camera great pictures. Consumer Electronic City is the seller and they delivered camera fast and everything was as they said thank you

Reviews.Title: Utterely useless , if you insist on buying I have one for sale
Reviews.Author: Stephen Wardleworth
Reviews.Content: For sale Nikon L610 3 months old, in excess oof 24 batteries used, 200 photos taken and all 200 out of focus.Camera according to Niko is within spec.If you need a camera to photograph scenery and stills  please buy mine. if you need to photograph people that move. by a Canon.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: We had this camera less than 2 months when on our first day at Disneyland the lens jammed. Sent it in for warranty repair which cost us $11 in shipping.  They still have the camera waiting on parts so we missed using it at Christmas.  And now I see they are selling it at half the price we paid.  I guess that is why they lowered the price, its a crappy camera.

Reviews.Title: Video recording just not working at all!!!
Reviews.Author: Eugene
Reviews.Content: The battery low sign appears in a few min after video mode is choosen, even if batteries just new.looks like a design fault of this model.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Hollis Smith
Reviews.Content: It is easy to use and pricewise you cannot beat it. highly recommend it to novices like myself. Point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: love this cam!
Reviews.Author: DevinedeltA
Reviews.Content: OMG best camera ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!HD pictures, I had paparazzi's jealous of my pictures. LOL. one tip...DO SPEND MONEY ON A GOOD BATTERY! it does eat up regular batteries.

Reviews.Title: Please don't buy this camera.
Reviews.Author: Brian Seeley
Reviews.Content: ********************************************************In the course of the last year of ownership I have learned a few things to make this better.-Get one of those higher quality lithium batteries for "high tech" devices.  It significantly improved battery performance.-Get a speed 10 memory card.  A lot of the delay between pictures is a result the memory card speed.-I have still found no way to improve the blurry pictures.With these changes in mind the rating is improved to 3 stars.*********************************************************Lets try and keep this clean with no low blows:-Battery life is terrible.  If you take 10 pictures in a row your battery will be dead.  It isn't that the battery is totally depleted, so much as it draws to much power at a time.  If you take a picture here and a picture there throughout the day you will be fine, but who buys a 250 dollar camera for that?-Time between pictures is terrible as well - At best you can take a picture every 12 seconds, it takes that long for it to recover after shooting one off.-Shutter speed depends solely on the flash being open or closed.  With the flash closed you shouldn't even try to take photos of close things that are even slowly walking around, they will be blurry.  Opening the flash helps, but the flash always goes off.  There is no way to take a close up picture in the bright light with the flash closed without it being blurry.  This effects me because I like to take pictures of people on stage, or in museums where flash photography isn't allowed.

Reviews.Title: Mother Board Problems
Reviews.Author: Gabriel Besnier
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for Christmas 2012. In February 2013 presented a problem and stopped working.When I sent it to repair the diagnosis was that the motherboard is poor to work properly.

Reviews.Title: Good quality pictures
Reviews.Author: Stan Cohen
Reviews.Content: This camera is still new to me. I have to get used to pressing the "scene" button after turning the camera on - before I can take shots. A step that I did not have to take with my old Canon. Also, the L610 sometimes , after turning on, shows a not full battery condition - when I know the battery is fine. Otherwise, this camera does what I expected it to do. The screen provides a really nice, bright image. Kind of slow charge recovery after using flash.SC

Reviews.Title: nikon camera
Reviews.Author: pbf "pbf"
Reviews.Content: do NOT buy this model of camera -- I had it less than one month when the zoom lens stopped working.  I had not dropped it or abused it in any way.  We returned it to Nikon as it was under warranty service - at first they said it would be repaired free of cost.  Two weeks later they want to charge me $100 as the cover is cracked.  It was not cracked when we returned it.  It is a piece of junk and Nikon's customer service is non-existent.I wish I had returned the camera to amazon rather than to Nikon for service.  Never will buy another nikon camera.

Reviews.Title: Easy easy
Reviews.Author: Shannon Wadsworth
Reviews.Content: I loooooove this camera. It takes great pictures and is quick and easy to whip out and capture the moment.

Reviews.Title: An old model but a good camera
Reviews.Author: KSArnold
Reviews.Content: This is a great mid sized point and shoot camera.  It has a nice sized lens so you can take close ups but shouldn't need a tri pod much.  There is not much you can do for experimenting with exposure.  You can play with colors some with the black and white feature where you can add just one color.  There is a rainbow of colors to choise from.  This is the feature I bought the camera for.  The camera uses two AA batteries and is a bit bigger than most point and shoots.  It fits nice in my hand and feels solid.  I bought a used model with no manual and it only took a couple minutes to get used to the functions.  Anyone that gets one of these with a manual should be able to understand the camera very quickly.  A good camera worth buying.

Reviews.Title: Great camera that eats batteries for lunch
Reviews.Author: Howzitboy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a while ago and finally decided to give a review. I had an older coolpix but when I let my daughter borrow it, she broke the battery door when she fell on it ice skating.The camera is pretty easy to use, takes really clear pictures that you can blow up without my distortion. Nice contrast and pretty good color too. The zoom is 14x but when you zoom past the optical zoom section, its a digital zoom meaning it will just enlarge the image taking a pretty crappy picture. The image stabilizer works great except when the winds blowing! I'm used to a full sized camera, so using this tiny thing in the wind is impossible for me.I use this camera when I go hiking and its perfect for that! I used to take my regular camera (Nikon D300) with lenses, tripod, flash etc and by time I hiked to my destination, I'm too tired to take any pictures. Switching to the coolpix is the perfect solution. Fact that it uses AA batteries means I can shoot all day without draining the batteries. I carry 8 AA in my camera pouch for my longer hikes.I love taking video with this camera too. I carry a gopro and my Nikon and find that the Nikon's video is 100x sharper then the gopros! The image stabilizer makes my videos nice and steady, not shaky like the gopro.now for the negatives:Battery life is terrible!! This camera is great for taking pictures, the batteries last long long time but if you shoot video with it, make sure you invest in a giant pack of AA batteries!! This camera will drain a pair of new AA batteries in less then 10 minutes of shooting!! BUT, the batteries aren't fully dead, the camera I think overheats them (they are hot when you take them out) and the fail, Swap them out, let them cool down and you can get a few more minutes of video out of them.Video: When I shoot video and I'm doing a longer shot, the camera will have a frame thats half black. You can see when it happens thru the screen. When you edit the footage, you'll have to chop that frame out. Sometimes its noticeable, sometimes not.. And when you're filming and zoom in, its NOT an optical zoom! Its a digital zoom meaning the image is just enlarged via software so it gets grainy pretty quickly. And you can't cant zoom very far in either and it doesnt zoom very fast. Another problem is you can't zoom in, film then zoom out (shoot from long shot to wide angle).overall its a wonderful camera exceeding my expectations and would gladly buy it again. Even with the few flaws, I love it and will use it till it falls apart.

Reviews.Title: poor quailty photos
Reviews.Author: b drake
Reviews.Content: Takes worse pics then my cheapo Kodak camera.  Very disappointed.  Big, bulky & a total waste of money. Don't buy one.

Reviews.Title: Great Product for a great price !
Reviews.Author: Ralph W Davidson
Reviews.Content: It is an excellent light weight camera that takes great pictures !  I would recommend to anyone who wants to take great digital pictures, and it is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Arlen G. Clemons "Mr Grant"
Reviews.Content: No, it's NOT a DSLR, but it has a lot of cool features that make it fun to use. I like the Scene settings and there is a light compensation switch that can brighten/darken your shot before you shoot.  This really helps take a good shot in minimal lighting.  Only problem was that the shutter sometimes seems a bit slow, but changing the Scene settings seems to fix that quickly. Overall a pretty good point and shot camera.  Easy to carry, fun to work with.

Reviews.Title: Disappointment
Reviews.Author: texaschick
Reviews.Content: This will probably be my last Nikon.  I've always trusted the name and reputation but this camera has been a disappointment. I have to change the batteries constantly and the flash is almost worthless.  I haven't been able to take a good flash picture yet and I've had the camera over a year. Once I do take a flash picture, it takes the camera a long time to recover.  I've only used the video two times and both times, the film was grainy. The only good thing I can say is that it takes good outdoor shots as long as there is adequate light. The big problem there is that in bright daylight, you cannot read the screen and there is no viewfinder.

Reviews.Title: Flawed camera
Reviews.Author: Koelker Photography
Reviews.Content: While this camera can take great pictures, the mechanics are flawed.  The battery life is impossible.  20 shots and new lithium batteries are nearly dead and the camera won't work.  No the camera will only turn on sporadically and dies after one or two shots.Nikon has so far dodged my attempts to get a repair of exchange.  I am sorely disappointed in Nikon on this one.

Reviews.Title: I would not recommend buying this.
Reviews.Author: Amanda Moore
Reviews.Content: The shipping speed was wonderful. Package arrived on time without any damage. I like the camera, but it's not as up to date as I thought it would be. My fault though for not researching as I should have.*2 weeks later*I have considered returning this camera. The flash does not come on automatically. The batteries last through about a 100 photos and after taking pictures for about 5 minutes the camera says "Battery exhausted" and I have to cut it off for about 10 minutes before I can use it again. I am not happy at all with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Slow
Reviews.Author: EL
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on price and consumer reports ratings when replacing my last.  I get frustrated with it easily because it is very slow to autofocus, slow to change zoom, and slow between taking pictures especially with the flash. I like that it uses AA batteries but so do many other cameras these days. The pictures it takes are very nice, but taking them is more work than it should be.  Also, the menu for changing settings is somewhat time consuming compared to other models.

Reviews.Title: My brand New Nikon
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: The camera came in great conditions, it was well packed and well received by the way im satisfied with my perches . I haven't gotten any problems, i really suggest people to buy a camera .

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX L610 is Disappointing!
Reviews.Author: JustMe
Reviews.Content: Will consume more batteries than you care to buy and the lens-as much as it is great-is prone to errors and just getting stuck for no good reason. Would not recommend buying it.

Reviews.Title: Kind of dissapointed
Reviews.Author: Colleen Roth
Reviews.Content: I really thought this was going to be a great camera so I was disappointed that it seems to have some quirks that I can't quite figure out.  Nothing that makes me want to return the camera but I wouldn't recommend it to a friend or buy again.  And the other reviews are right, it really blows through batteries so we use rechargable ones.  But it's still annoying to have to replace them so frequently.

Reviews.Title: Software (NikonView NX2) will not download to my computer
Reviews.Author: DWIGHT T. WALKER
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera at a very good price (129.00) from Amazon.  It does everything I could expect, but the software (NikonView NX2) refuses to downlOad to my  Microsoft  Windows 7 computer.  I have communicated daily for over a week with Nikon Customer Support in an attempt to resolve this matter, because if you can't download pictures, what good is it?  Maybe I'll have to resort to a card reader or get  a different camera.Nikon COOLPIX L610 16 MP Digital Camera with 14x Zoom NIKKOR Glass Lens and 3-inch LCD (Silver)

Reviews.Title: Like it, but it eats batteries.
Reviews.Author: Skruffy
Reviews.Content: I like the camera really well. It has enough heft to feel like you're holding something but small enough to put in a pocket. The instructions leave a bit to be desired but that seems typical - at least I don't have to read them evey time I use it. It really does use up the batteries though.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera.
Reviews.Author: Vernice
Reviews.Content: Love the glass lens, and all the other features that are there.  Red is also my favorite color and none of my friends have one.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L610-WORST CAMERA EVER!
Reviews.Author: Baltimore Teacher-to-Be
Reviews.Content: I'm a teacher who videotapes a lot, and I bought this because--let me be honest--it was inexpensive.  The most significant problem is that it doesn't hold a charge worth a dime.  After 5 or 10 minutes, I get "battery exhausted" or "out of memory."I returned the camera, thinking that maybe I just got a lemon, but the same thing happened with camera #2.  There are too many design flaws with this camera.  I'm taking it back and trying something else.Nikon should be too ashamed to sell this so-called camera.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix L610 Review
Reviews.Author: Brent Bowman
Reviews.Content: Can not use regular AA batteries.  Zoom feature is difficult to manipulate and get precise.  Overall an average camera which was rated as being so great.

Reviews.Title: coolpix is uncool
Reviews.Author: difabio
Reviews.Content: an inferior digital at any price-the camera was purchased for my high school journalism class; I am not prejudiced by out of pocket expense-there is a reason why it is deeply discounted-STAY AWAY from this camera

Reviews.Title: Bummed :(
Reviews.Author: katherine
Reviews.Content: I'm real bummed this camera did not work out.  I purchased this camera for Christmas and I am already returning it.  I lost out on many good pictures because the flash option is very difficult to figure out, and the batteries do die VERY quickly.  I wasn't impressed.

Reviews.Title: Compact enough for most pockets
Reviews.Author: B. A Kroczak "barbkro"
Reviews.Content: One of the previous reviews here and the photographs of the camera itself made me worry that this camera would be too large.  So I was pleasantly surprised when I got it how small and compact it is.  It may not fit into a jeans pocket but it's easily small enough to fit into a jacket or coat pocket. So the 5 stars here is just for size.Now to see what kinds of photographs it takes...

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I chose this for the price and based on other reviews.  I wanted it for a specific purpose (family gathering) and got some great shots.  The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because I haven't used it very much and explored many of the camera's features.

Reviews.Title: Not for me
Reviews.Author: Vintagekeys
Reviews.Content: I was excited when I read about this camera online and test drove it at the store I was excited because of the 14x zoom and the fact its a Nikon. I have the larger professional grade 3100 and LOVE it, but wanted something small and light I can take around in my coat pocket for quick shots of the family while out.I purchased it and was immediately turned off at the fact it uses AA batteries as opposed to a rechargeable battery pack.  Additionally I found it too bulky to fit comfortably in a suit or coat pocket.  I really wanted a small functional digital camera that took great pictures and HD video.  This takes great pics/vids but its much too bulking and the AA batteries in this day and age = FAIL...

Reviews.Title: Not For Small Children!
Reviews.Author: Deanna C. Hanna "Deanna"
Reviews.Content: We loved the way it was designed, easy to hold and buttons user friendly, however, out of 36 photos with two toddlers only 6 were good.  The slightest movement of the subject or the picturetaker caused a blur.  Such a shame as we loved the way it felt.  Great design for senior citizens but not if you're taking photos of the great grandkids.

Reviews.Title: Annoying items about this camera:
Reviews.Author: Nina Katrina "Nina"
Reviews.Content: It lacks eyelets to which to attach camera strap.A small lid opens but does NOT snap shut when I try to close it.Shoddy work to ignore fixing such small details yet to claim the camera is a good buy.Will not recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Poor quality pictures and physical design
Reviews.Author: Tom Eckhout
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product as a gift and have not been satisfied with the photo quality. Far too many blurry images when just taking quiet family photos.Recently it fell out of my wife's purse from less than 2 feet and the battery door is now broken. Nikon will not fix it under warranty and want $119.00 for the repair. I paid $129.00 for it new!! We have had it tor 6 months.I will not be purchasing another Nikon product.

Reviews.Title: Only good when you don't need a flash
Reviews.Author: PDXer
Reviews.Content: Bought this from Costco but am planning on taking it back.  The flash has to manually be lifted up, so it will never tell you if you need it, an then it will hardly ever use the flash anyways resulting in lots of blurry pictures.  Ok camera if you don't have kids that move and everyone can stay perfectly still.  Also the battery life is terrible even after trying the eneloop rechargeable.

Reviews.Title: Wondering about time-lapse video
Reviews.Author: Ken E
Reviews.Content: The description of the L610 on another web site (B&H;) includes the following statement: "Within Movie Mode, there is a time-lapse feature for the capture of sequences of single frames at interval rates from 30 sec to 60 min. When the sequence is finished, the camera will automatically compile the images into a flip-book-like, stop-action video."However, when I go to the Nikon web site and download the manual, I cannot find a single word on time-lapse.Can you tell me it the L610 really has a time-lapse function?

ProductInfo.Features:
16.0 MP CMOS sensor
Full HD (1080p) movie recording
14x optical zoom (25-350mm)
Optical VR image stabilization minimizes camera shake
3-inch LCD monitor
ProductInfo.Name: Nikon COOLPIX L610 Digital Camera (Red)
